business.headline: Filing ITR-2 or ITR-3? Check these common mistakes and tips to avoid themUsing the Excel utility for ITR-2 or ITR-3 seems easy, but it's easy to get stuck if you're not careful. One wrong entry can throw your entire tax calculation off. Here's a handy guide to avoid common slip-ups.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

Sensex, Nifty today: Inflation drops, but will stock markets rise?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,166 points around 8:22 am, suggesting a possible higher start for Nifty50, which closed at 25,082.3 on Monday. This points to cautious optimism on Dalal Street after four straight sessions of losses.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO allotment: Online guide to see status. Check GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (also known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Bitcoin hits record $123,000 as US policy hopes boost crypto marketBitcoin is up about 30% so far this year and its rise has lifted other coins too. Ether, the second-biggest token, climbed to a five-month high of $3,059. XRP and Solana also rose about 3% each.

Retail inflation cools to 6-year low of 2.10% in JuneThis is the fifth month in a row that inflation has remained below the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, and the eighth consecutive month it has stayed under the central bank's upper limit of 6%
Sensex closes 247 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 247.01 points to close at 82,253.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 67.55 points to end at 25,082.30.

Trap, click, renew: How OTT apps make it hard to cancel subscriptionsAccording to data collected by community platform LocalCircles, 50% of respondents said they have frequently had difficulty cancelling subscriptions to digital services.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why your portfolio should be yours, not someone else'sBuilding your investment portfolio should match your own risk comfort, timeframe and goals. What works for your friend may not work for you, says MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, Radhika Gupta.

Why your tax refund may be delayed this yearOne big reason for the delay is that the tax filing season began late this year. Normally, people can file their returns from April onwards. But this time, the Income Tax Department released the ITR utilities quite late.
Sensex down 400 points: Why is stock market falling todayAs of 11:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down by 388.85 points to 82,111.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 110.85 points to 25,039.00.

Only 6.7% filed ITRs: CoinSwitch co-founder on why Indians delay tax filingIndia has made big progress in digital tax filing over the years. There are new portals, better forms and more ways to pay taxes online. Yet, millions still wait till the last few days to get their documents in order.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 5% todayOla Electric share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 43.60 before trading 5.45% higher at Rs 41.99 around 11:11 am, shortly after the electric two-wheeler maker announced its financial results for the first quarter of FY26.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

Travel Food Services to make market debut today; here's the latest GMPTravel Food Services listing: The grey market premium (GMP), which had dropped sharply in the past week, has seen a slight rise ahead of the listing.

Jane Street deposits Rs 4,843.5 crore, set to return to Dalal Street: ReportIn its interim order, Sebi had accused Jane Street of using manipulative strategies in Indian stock markets. The regulator directed the firm to deposit alleged unlawful gains in an escrow account with a scheduled commercial bank in India.

Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.

Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

entertainment.headline: Jaws @ 50 The Definitive Story review: Steven Spielberg's shark saga still has biteRelease Date:Thu Jul 10, 2025The documentary 'Jaws @ 50: The Definitive Inside Story' dives into the legacy of Steven Spielberg's iconic shark thriller with rare footage and heartfelt insights, reminding us why 'Jaws' still makes waves.

Farah Khan says people celebrated Tees Maar Khan failure, felt they put her in placeFarah Khan shared that the failure of 'Tees Maar Khan' was met with open celebration by some in the film industry, with even former collaborators mocking her. Despite the backlash, she shared that the film has found popularity among Gen Z, who now consider it a cult favourite.

Travis Scott adds Mumbai concert to India tour after Delhi sells outRap star Travis Scott has announced another show in India, following the sell-out of his concert tickets for the Delhi show. Know more details here.

Kriti Sanon and rumoured partner Kabir Bahia cheer for team India at Lord's groundActor Kriti Sanon recently joined her rumoured partner Kabir Bahia at the Lord's cricket ground for the India vs England test. Bahia shared his picture with Sanon on his Instagram story.

Butterfly trailer: Daniel Dae Kim's show blends global espionage with slick actionPrime Video has unveiled the official trailer for Butterfly, a spy thriller starring Daniel Dae Kim. The series explores global espionage and personal betrayal, set to premiere worldwide in August 2025.

Harry Potter series in production: Dominic McLaughlin, and new cast details outHBO kicks off production on the new Harry Potter series, revealing Dominic McLaughlin as the new Harry. Cast details, first look, and fan reactions inside.

Prabhas watches Brad Pitt's F1 with bestie Prashanth Neel, fans spot the power duoActor Prabhas and director Prashanth Neel were spotted watching 'F1' at Prasads Multiplex in Hyderabad, with fan-clicked photos going viral online. Fans called them 'besties' while expressing excitement over the duo's reunion after 'Salaar'.

Sindoor before art: Anupam Kher's strong take on Diljit Dosanjh's Sardaar Ji 3 rowAnupam Kher voices concerns over Diljit Dosanjh's collaboration with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3', questioning the implications of working across borders.

Ramayana's budget: Not Rs 1600 crore, Ranbir's film is Rs 4000 crore epic in 2 partsNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana' is set to become India's most expensive film ever, with a budget crossing Rs 4000 crore for both parts. Starring Ranbir Kapoor, Yash, and Sai Pallavi, the film promises a grand cinematic experience with world-class VFX, AI dubbing, and music by Hans Zimmer and AR Rahman.

Producer Dheeraj Kumar hospitalised with pneumonia, in critical conditionVeteran actor and producer Dheeraj Kumar is in critical condition at Mumbai's Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital due to pneumonia. He is currently on ventilator support in the ICU.

Madam Secretary stars Téa Leoni and Tim Daly wed in private NYC ceremonyTéa Leoni and Tim Daly, co-stars of Madam Secretary, married in a private New York City ceremony after nearly a decade-long relationship that began quietly on the show's set in 2014.

First look at new Harry Potter revealed as TV series begins productionProduction has officially begun on the new Harry Potter TV series, with the first look at Dominic McLaughlin as Harry revealed. The new series, debuting in 2027, has a fresh cast and will follow J.K. Rowling's original books.

Richa Chadha condemns Radhika Yadav's killing, calls her father Deepak a loserActor Richa Chadha has voiced her outrage over the shocking murder of Radhika Yadav, allegedly at the hands of her father Deepak Yadav. She blamed deep-rooted societal pressures for the horrific act.

Dhanashree Verma, Yuzvendra Chahal's ex-wife, to join Bigg Boss 19: ReportIndian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's ex-wife and influencer Dhanashree Verma may join 'Bigg Boss 19'. She is reportedly in final negotiations with the makers of the reality show.

Anurag Kashyap on T-Series underpaying his films' music: They don't get good musicDirector Anurag Kashyap recently opened up about being underpaid by T-Series for the music of 'Dev D' (2009) and 'Gangs of Wasseypur' (2012). He criticised the music label for undervaluing quality in film music.

Tomorrow actor Lee Soo-hyuk leaves YG after 8 years, joins Sooyoung's agencySARAM Entertainment, which currently manages talents like Sooyoung and Park Gyu-young, is all set to welcome actor Lee Soo-hyuk to its roster. Here's all you need to know.

Shanaya Kapoor says no competition with BFFs Ananya-Suhana: They're familyShanaya Kapoor opens up about her close friendship with Ananya Panday and Suhana Khan. She emphasises that competition does not exist among them as they consider each other family.

B Saroja Devi dies at 87: PM Modi calls her pillar of Indian cinemaVeteran actor B Saroja Devi died at 87, leaving a lasting impact on Indian cinema. Her diverse roles across languages marked her as a versatile icon, mourned by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari release date out. See Varun, Janhvi's first lookThe first-look posters of actors Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor from the upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' were unveiled on Monday.  Directed by Shashank Khaitan, the film is set for release on October 2 this year.

general news.headline: Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.

Institutional betrayal: Naveen Patnaik tears into BJP over Odisha student's deathBJD chief Naveen Patnaik and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi assailed the ruling BJP over the death of the Odisha student who had alleged sexual harassment, calling it a "planned injustice" and "murder by system".

S Jaishankar meets China's Xi Jinping, first since 2020 Galwan clashS Jaishankar, who is on his first China visit in five years, said he apprised the Chinese President of the recent development in bilateral ties.

Non-veg milk a red line in India-US trade talks. Here's whyAmid the India-US trade deal talks, Washington DC wants New Delhi to open its dairy market. But India insists on strict certification that ensures imported milk comes from cows not fed animal-based products like meat or blood. Rooted in religious and cultural sensitivities, India sees this as the "non-negotiable red line".

Shux to splashdown today: All eyes on fiery re-entry into Earth  LIVE UPDATESThe SpaceX Dragon spacecraft carrying Shukla and the multinational Ax-4 crew undocked from the ISS at 4:30 pm IST on Monday, beginning a meticulously planned 22-hour return journey.

Karachi-bound Pak man ends up in Saudi Arabia after flight goof-up, had no passportThe passenger boarded the wrong aircraft at Lahore Airport and only realised the mistake two hours into the flight when it became evident the plane was bound for an international destination.

Northeast improves on hunger, poverty parameters, a decade after Act EastThe latest North Eastern Region SDG Index shows that 85% of districts are now classified as Front Runners, with the number of Achiever districts more than doubling since the 2021-22 report. Mizoram, Tripura, and Sikkim are among the top performers, while 75% of districts in conflict-torn Manipur are high-performing.

UK regulator flagged Boeing fuel switches four weeks before Air India crashThe UK Civil Aviation Authority issued a safety notice on fuel control switches on Boeing 787s weeks before the Air India crash. This raises concerns over oversight and aircraft safety compliance.

Odisha student, who self-immolated over inaction on harassment complaint, diesThe student reportedly set herself ablaze after repeated complaints of sexual harassment by her college's Head of Department allegedly went unaddressed by the principal and college authorities.
Shux is coming home: Trailblazing return flight explained in graphicsThe departure from the Space Station follows a series of meticulously planned steps to ensure a safe and smooth return to Earth.

Aviation influencer's wedding aboard Boeing 747 takes love to the skies. Watch videoAround 100 seats were removed from the aircraft as it was reimagined as an airborne wedding venue - complete with an aisle for the bridal walk, a dance floor, and a space for speeches and celebrations.

Heartbreaking, embarrassing: Chase after WI fold for 27 in shocking collapseWest Indies skipper Roston Chase has labelled his team's dramatic batting collapse against Australia in Jamaica as "heartbreaking" and "embarrassing", after they were dismissed for 27, one of the lowest scores in Test cricket history.

Mitchell Starc cherishes special week after historic spell in his 100th TestMitchell Starc starred in Australia's thumping win over the West Indies with a sensational six-wicket haul in the pink-ball Test. Celebrating his 100th Test, Starc became the fastest bowler to take a five-wicket haul in Test cricket.

Ben Stokes, England's heart and soul, is beyond the statsEngland captain Ben Stokes gave a jaw dropping performance in the Lord's Test match. Braving pain, Stokes bowled a total of 44 overs, in an effort that once again furthered his legacy as a true leader in world cricket.

Sledging didn't backfire at Lord's, 5 minutes can't define 5 days: Shubman GillIndia captain Shubman Gill defended his sledging of England batters on Day 3 at Lord's, saying that it wasn't the turning point of the Test match. India lost the match by 22 runs chasing 193 in the fourth innings.

Shubman Gill defends Jadeja's approach with tail after India's Lord's defeatIndia captain Shubman Gill defended Ravindra Jadeja's approach, batting with the tail on Day 5 of the third Test against England at Lord's. July 14 again: How Stokes's gut feeling about Archer worked wonders in 3rd TestBen Stokes revealed the reason why he decided to stick with Jofra Archer early on Day 5 to crack open the Lord's Test on Monday, July 14. Archer picked up three wickets as England won the match by 22 runs.

Jadeja's defiance in vain as England defend 192 in fiery Lord's epicIndia vs England: England raised the stakes on Day 5, successfully defending 192 at Lord's. Despite a gritty knock from Ravindra Jadeja, India fell short by 22 runs, undone by the top order's recklessness. Ben Stokes and his men now lead 2-1 in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Fourth innings curse strikes India again, miss golden chance at Lord'sIndia's past horrors from the fourth innings chases came back to haunt them again as they missed a golden opportunity to take a 2-1 lead in the series against England.

Ben Stokes all riled up after India targeted Crawley on Day 3: Stuart BroadENG vs IND: Stuart Broad reckons that Ben Stokes may be out for revenge after the way the Indian players had targeted Zak Crawley earlier in the Lord's Test.

R Ashwin slams Paul Reiffel for his controversial calls in third TestFormer cricketer R Ashwin criticised Paul Reiffel on his YouTube channel Ash Ki Baat, questioning decisions made by the umpire during the third Test between India and England at Lord's.

Wrestlemania at Lord's: Ravindra Jadeja, Brydon Carse engage in ugly spat mid-pitchIndia all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja and Brydon Carse engaged in an ugly spat after their mid-pitch collision on Day 5 of the third Test against England at Lord's.

Asian Champion Jyothi Yarraji undergoes ACL surgery, out of World ChampionshipsAsian Champion and national record holder Jyothi Yarraji has undergone successful surgery to repair an ACL tear. The surgery will keep Yarraji out of the World Championships in September and ended her season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
